channel.title: Timeline of the City's History: 1898 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930
channel.description: Recent content in Timeline of the City's History: 1898 on Homicide in Chicago 1870-1930

item.title: Grinnell is Dead
item.description: Julius B. Grinnell died of heart disease. Other images from this year

item.title: Inspector Shaack Dies
item.description: North Side Inspector M. J. Schaak Dies after Illness. Source: Chicago Daily Tribune, May 19, 1898 Other images from this year

item.title: State and Randolph Streets
item.description: The southwest corner of State and Randolph Streets showing the old Bay State Building. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: The Canyon of La Salle Street
item.description: The canyon of La Salle Street with the facade of the Board of Trade. The Rockery Building and the Royal Insurance Company are at the left. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year

item.title: The Haymarket Square on Randolph Street between Halsted and Des Plaines Streets
item.description: In the foreground is the Police Monument by F. Gelert, commemorating the police officers killed in the Haymarket Riot on May 4, 1886. Here farm wagons, drays, peddler carts and street carts jostled another for many generations. Today there is little produce business done here. Courtesy of “Chicago and Its Makers” (Chicago: Felix Mendelsohn, 1929). Other images from this year
